title: Brazil plane crash: Three dead as aircraft slams into cars in residential street

At least three people are dead after a plane crashed into cars shortly after take-off , triggering explosions and an inferno in the street.

Twisted aircraft wreckage and several cars were on fire as smoke billowed from a neighbourhood in Belo Horizonte in south-eastern Brazil.

The three people who were killed were an occupant of the plane, a pedestrian and a person who was in one of the cars, said firefighters.

Local reports said the small plane crashed shortly after taking off from Carlos Prates Airport - the second time in seven months an aircraft has crashed on the same street.

Did you witness the incident? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk.

(Image: Twitter)

Residents used water hoses from their homes in a desperate bid to extinguish the flames in the city's Caicaras district on Monday morning.

The plane's red and white parachute lay nearby in the road.

Reports claimed it was a Cirrus SR20 plane with a capacity for four people - a pilot and three passengers.

Civil servant Carlos Henrique Pacheco Diniz, 37, said he heard a massive explosion as the plane crashed.

(Image: Twitter)

He told Ata News that he rushed outside and tried to help.

He added: "We tried to put out the fire. There were a lot of explosions and we couldn't help anymore.

"I was home and heard a crash. I went out and saw the flames."

Firefighters raced to the scene - less than a mile from the airport - to extinguish the blaze at about 8am.

(Image: Twitter)

Almost 6,000 homes in the area were without electricity.

In April, a pilot was killed when a small plane crashed into the same street, not far from the scene of Monday's crash.

Residents have raised concerns about living under the flight path and demanded action from local officials.

One resident, who posted footage of the cars and aircraft wreckage on fire on Monday, tweeted: "Minerva Street in Caicara has a serious plane problem, (this) is already the second (crash)."

Belo Horizonte is about 250 miles north of Rio de Janeiro and the sixth-largest city in Brazil.
description: The plane crashed into cars in the street - setting off explosions and an inferno - shortly after taking off from Carlos Prates Airport in Belo Horizonte, Brazil
